body: At a guess I'd say this has to do with the fact that `graph:1` was not a legal prefixed name in TriG (the localname part of prefixed name can not start with a number). Or at least this was the case in the old spec - it's probably been updated in the new TriG spec but not yet fixed in our parser.
More generally I'd say that we need to take another good look at both the Turtle and the TriG parser and update them to be compliant against the latest specs.
I thought that both Turtle and Trig had been updated to RDF-1.1 way back in Sesame-2.7, but may have missed something when I did it.

For Turtle and Trig, that share very similar compliance test suites in RDF-1.1, there is a test that should be run which verifies localName's can have an integer, although it may be missing corner cases such as the graph name and there may be a small change needed there:

https://github.com/eclipse/rdf4j/blob/master/testsuites/rio/src/main/resources/testcases/turtle/tests-ttl-w3c-20131121/localName_with_leading_digit.ttl

https://github.com/eclipse/rdf4j/blob/master/testsuites/rio/src/main/resources/testcases/trig/localName_with_leading_digit.trig
@ansell I may have been misled by the Javadoc in both parsers, which still quotes the old (pre-W3C) specs as leading the implementation. I guess we should update that then :)

Thanks for looking into this...  It does look like the spec allows numbers for [PN_CHARS](https://www.w3.org/TR/trig/#grammar-production-PN_CHARS).

Incidentally I tried updating my file to have `graph:a` as the graph clause and it still seems to come out as null.
I will try to make time today to write up a set of regression tests as it is clear the TriG-1.1 compliance suite hasn't picked this up.

issue.title: issue#254 : Change TriG parser to not assume "GRAPH" is the SPARQL Keyword

repository.name: rdf4j
repository.description: Eclipse RDF4J: scalable RDF for Java

issue.body:
This PR addresses GitHub issue: #254 

Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:
- Add regression test for issue#254 to confirm bug
- Change the TriG parser to not assume that "GRAPH" is the SPARQL keyword if there is a colon immediately following it, as it could have been used as a pname in that case

Make sure you've followed the [Contributor Guidelines](https://github.com/eclipse/rdf4j/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md). In particular (please tick to indicate you've taken care of it):
- [x] RDF4J code formatting has been applied
- [x] tests are included
- [x] all tests succeed

body: The bug seems to be that you chose the name "graph" for the prefix. The keyword "GRAPH" (case-insensitive) probably/may be rejected in TriG-1.1 as a prefix name because it is a reserved word inherited from SPARQL. On the other hand, I will try to find a way of parsing it before asking the W3C for their opinion as to whether it is a valid prefix in that context.
